Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Job Title: Remote Undersea Warfare Range Computer Systems Analyst
Job Description:
Peraton Overview

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the worlds leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our 22,000 employees do the cant be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.


Responsibilities

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense. The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. With the ever-accelerating technological advances and growing system complexity, NSA needs System Engineers to integrate systems and reduce the cost to operate and maintain systems. To meet these demands, the NSA hires and trains talented and highly motivated junior and senior systems engineers, electrical engineers, computer scientists, computer engineers, and other related professionals. We need our System Engineers to provide program oversight and implement Systems Engineering best practices across the organization in the NSA enterprise. The need to maintain our core System Engineers group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The ever increasing complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class System Engineers to solve challenging systems engineering problems to enable NSA to successfully execute its mission. Recent college graduates and junior System Engineers are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office or one of two Development Programs (The System Engineer Development Program (SEDP) or the Information Technology Development Program (ITDP)). The SEDP prepares recent college graduates and junior level technical staff for a career in Systems Engineering at NSA. During the three-year program, participants will rotate assignments, attend training that covers the full breadth of systems engineering disciplines, and earn DoD DAWIA and other important credentials. The ITDP is a three-year full-time development program designed to provide entry-level information technology specialists (that is, individuals with degrees in computer science, information systems, information technology, and related degrees and experience) the opportunity to learn the various facets of the NSA mission, including: - Systems Engineering/Security Engineering - Software Engineering - SW Project Management - System Architecture - Database Design As a System Engineer at the NSA responsibilities may include: - requirements definition, requirements analysis and requirements management - system architecture and design - integration and testing - configuration management - risk management - decision analysis - security engineering - provide system engineering expertise, guidance and support to the development and implementation of mission capabilities that align with mission driven priorities - lead and implement system engineering effort, mentor junior personnel - capture high-level concepts and translate into engineering documents and other artifacts - act as advocates for and implement Systems Engineering and Enterprise Architecture best practices and principles - craft high-level system design, specify system/component performance and interface requirements and develop installation, integration and acceptance test plans

As a Hardware Systems Engineer at Facebook Reality Labs, you will lead architecture on upcoming AR/VR/Wearables products, help drive the overall strategy & roadmap, and be a part of the teams designing, building, and testing prototypes for future consumer AR/VR/Wearables reality experiences. We want people who: work well in teams, can brainstorm big ideas, work in new technology areas, thrive in ambiguity, able to map tradespaces, able to drive a concept into a prototype, and can envision how a prototype could transition into a high-volume consumer product.The Reality Labs Hardware Systems Engineer will lead the definition and convergence of complex and novel sub-system and product architectures aimed at pushing beyond the state-of-the-art consumer AR/VR/Wearable systems. These can span new sensing systems, display/optics systems, input devices, and full VR headsets. The role requires expert technical communication with cross-functional teams across ID, hardware engineering, partnerships, supply chain and core technology groups to drive incubation of new technologies from proof of concept through integration into products for mass production. This role requires excellent technical understanding of consumer electronics and AR/VR/Wearable reality systems across the stack.Starting with a broad engineering background in electrical, mechanical, optics, silicon, or related fields, we’re looking for a unique system designer or architect. The ideal candidate would have strong systems skills, previous roles driving architecture convergence on complex consumer electronics products, and experience with SoC evaluation, optical systems, sensors, CV algorithms, software, and be able to work collaboratively with experts in different fields to make architectural tradeoffs.

MW Partners is currently seeking a Lead System and Software Safety Engineer to work for our client who is a global leader in the aerospace, defense and security markets.
We are looking for a Lead System and Software Safety Engineer. The Lead System and Software Safety
Engineer will be the Subject Matter Expert for system safety and compliance to software assurance requirements
taking on the responsibility of independently verifying and validating Safety and Software assurance engineering
activities in projects, products and bids and ultimately to ensure that NAS delivered systems as a whole are
within their acceptable level of safety.
Responsibilities and duties:
 Interface across disciplines providing ownership of system and software safety
 Act as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) providing guidance on the application of appropriate
methodologies and standards for system and software safety for ground systems
 Applicable standards include: DO-278A, ED-109A, ED-153, MIL-STD-882
 Experience with similar airborne standards can act as an alternative: ARP 4761, DO-178B, DO-178C
 Lead improvement initiatives to the current Safety Management System
 Solicit and coordinate, audits of Project Safety activities
 Represent system and software safety in Research and Technology (R&T) activities
 Contribute to the definition of the system and software safety strategic activities
 Maintain a system and software safety focused organization
 Define required skills & expertise
 Maintain required skills & expertise via regular communications and training
 Champion system and software safety across projects/products and bids
 Support the full system lifecycle from bids through product support
 Provide effort estimates for implementing required system and software safety aspects in support of bids
 Verify appropriate system and software safety baselines are defined, accounted for, and in line with the
business line’s strategy
 Own safety related documents such as the safety management plan and Plan for SW aspect of
Approval (PSAA) as well as the safety related aspects of other systems/software documents (e.g. SW
Accomplishment Summary [SAS])
 Manage project safety risks
 Ensure that the safety requirements are properly derived and implemented in the product/system
(specification and architecture) and safety objectives are met
 Work in a true multi-cultural context in a geographically diverse industrial footprint in several countries
 Adapt to a large portfolio of international customers with different and unique cultural sensitivities

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Job Description Summary
The Systems Engineer works in close collaboration with a cross-functional team made up of engineers, scientists, product management, clinical applications, researchers, customers, marketing and other field teams to define and develop new product technologies to meet customer needs. The Systems Engineer position distinguishes itself through a high emphasis on implementing and evaluating new product innovations and a strong focus on image/signal quality, system safety, and system calibration to drive significant design improvements in product architecture.

SAMS is launching an exciting new managed investing product called Schwab Personalized Indexing (SPI). Targeting more sophisticated investors, SPI will track a major equity index by investing directly in the index’s securities to mirror its performance. The product is managed by a proprietary portfolio management optimization which decides which securities by buy and sell based on investor preferences and market performance. Investors can customize their account with unique preferences by selecting a variety of benchmarks to track, exclude specific securities or industries and make other customizations to personalize their investment. SPI will be the first SAMS managed investing product to offer a completely digital onboarding experience to Schwab clients.

As a Hardware Systems Engineer at Facebook Reality Labs, you will lead architecture on upcoming AR/VR/Wearables products, help drive the overall strategy & roadmap, and be a part of the teams designing, building, and testing prototypes for future consumer AR/VR/Wearables reality experiences. We want people who: work well in teams, can brainstorm big ideas, work in new technology areas, thrive in ambiguity, able to map tradespaces, able to drive a concept into a prototype, and can envision how a prototype could transition into a high-volume consumer product.The Reality Labs Hardware Systems Engineer will lead the definition and convergence of complex and novel sub-system and product architectures aimed at pushing beyond the state-of-the-art consumer AR/VR/Wearable systems. These can span new sensing systems, display/optics systems, input devices, and full VR headsets. The role requires expert technical communication with cross-functional teams across ID, hardware engineering, partnerships, supply chain and core technology groups to drive incubation of new technologies from proof of concept through integration into products for mass production. This role requires excellent technical understanding of consumer electronics and AR/VR/Wearable reality systems across the stack.Starting with a broad engineering background in electrical, mechanical, optics, silicon, or related fields, we’re looking for a unique system designer or architect. The ideal candidate would have strong systems skills, previous roles driving architecture convergence on complex consumer electronics products, and experience with SoC evaluation, optical systems, sensors, CV algorithms, software, and be able to work collaboratively with experts in different fields to make architectural tradeoffs.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

Your Opportunity

SAMS Technology is aligned to support the technology needs of Schwab Asset Management Solutions (SAMS) which is a new Schwab organization that unites money management, research, and asset management platforms for mutual funds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), managed accounts, alternative investments and insurance. With over $500B in assets under management, SAMS is the 3rd largest provider of index funds and the 7th largest provider of money market funds and 5th largest ETF provider.
SAMS is launching an exciting new managed investing product called Schwab Personalized Indexing (SPI). Targeting more sophisticated investors, SPI will track a major equity index by investing directly in the index’s securities to mirror its performance. The product is managed by a proprietary portfolio management optimization which decides which securities by buy and sell based on investor preferences and market performance. Investors can customize their account with unique preferences by selecting a variety of benchmarks to track, exclude specific securities or industries and make other customizations to personalize their investment. SPI will be the first SAMS managed investing product to offer a completely digital onboarding experience to Schwab clients.

SENIOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER POSITION SUMMARY The Senior Systems Engineer will develop, implement, and support systems related services and solutions for consulting clients. This position will build a customer-focused relationship with client to identify business challenges and develop specifications and requirements to arrive at the best solution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

SPI will be the first SAMS managed investing product to offer a completely digital onboarding experience to Schwab clients.

Qualifications:

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

The Jaekle Group
The Jaekle Group is a Managed Services and Cloud Hosting firm located in Macedonia Ohio. We have been serving clients in northeastern Ohio for over 20 years and have been enjoying consistent growth each year. There are two sides to the business. First, we provide Managed Services (on premise support) for clients that do not have an IT department or need support with an existing IT staff. We become the department or a supplement to the existing IT Dept. This includes everything from break fix to project deployments.
Second, the other side of our business, Cloud Hosting, we host Citrix and Remote Desktop desktops for our clients who are choosing not to own equipment anymore. With this side of our business we have to support our clients in the field and with our datacenter operations. Our business is unique in that we can offer three types of solutions, on premise, hosted or a combination of the two.

The Jaekle Group
The Jaekle Group is a Managed Services and Cloud Hosting firm located in Macedonia Ohio. We have been serving clients in northeastern Ohio for over 20 years and have been enjoying consistent growth each year. There are two sides to the business. First, we provide Managed Services (on premise support) for clients that do not have an IT department or need support with an existing IT staff. We become the department or a supplement to the existing IT Dept. This includes everything from break fix to project deployments.
Second, the other side of our business, Cloud Hosting, we host Citrix and Remote Desktop desktops for our clients who are choosing not to own equipment anymore. With this side of our business we have to support our clients in the field and with our datacenter operations. Our business is unique in that we can offer three types of solutions, on premise, hosted or a combination of the two.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

SENIOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER POSITION SUMMARY The Senior Systems Engineer will develop, implement, and support systems related services and solutions for consulting clients. This position will build a customer-focused relationship with client to identify business challenges and develop specifications and requirements to arrive at the best solution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

The Jaekle Group
The Jaekle Group is a Managed Services and Cloud Hosting firm located in Macedonia Ohio. We have been serving clients in northeastern Ohio for over 20 years and have been enjoying consistent growth each year. There are two sides to the business. First, we provide Managed Services (on premise support) for clients that do not have an IT department or need support with an existing IT staff. We become the department or a supplement to the existing IT Dept. This includes everything from break fix to project deployments.
Second, the other side of our business, Cloud Hosting, we host Citrix and Remote Desktop desktops for our clients who are choosing not to own equipment anymore. With this side of our business we have to support our clients in the field and with our datacenter operations. Our business is unique in that we can offer three types of solutions, on premise, hosted or a combination of the two.

About TherapyNotes
TherapyNotes is the national leader in web-based behavioral health practice management and electronic health records software for private practices, psychologists, therapists, counselors, social workers and psychiatrists. Our software-as-a-service solution integrates patient scheduling, medical records, billing and electronic claims to streamline the way mental health professionals manage their practice.
TherapyNotes offers careers that provide you with the freedom to do amazing work, interact with great people, and offer fantastic learning and growth opportunities. Our team empowers and challenges each other to learn and solve complex problems. We build and manage web applications with a strong emphasis in healthcare. If you are looking to join a supportive team, use your leadership experience, and build great products, please submit your application.

Your Opportunity

SAMS Technology is aligned to support the technology needs of Schwab Asset Management Solutions (SAMS) which is a new Schwab organization that unites money management, research, and asset management platforms for mutual funds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), managed accounts, alternative investments and insurance. With over $500B in assets under management, SAMS is the 3rd largest provider of index funds and the 7th largest provider of money market funds and 5th largest ETF provider.
SAMS is launching an exciting new managed investing product called Schwab Personalized Indexing (SPI). Targeting more sophisticated investors, SPI will track a major equity index by investing directly in the index’s securities to mirror its performance. The product is managed by a proprietary portfolio management optimization which decides which securities by buy and sell based on investor preferences and market performance. Investors can customize their account with unique preferences by selecting a variety of benchmarks to track, exclude specific securities or industries and make other customizations to personalize their investment. SPI will be the first SAMS managed investing product to offer a completely digital onboarding experience to Schwab clients.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

The Jaekle Group is a Managed Services and Cloud Hosting firm located in Macedonia Ohio. We have been serving clients in northeastern Ohio for over 20 years and have been enjoying consistent growth each year. There are two sides to the business. First, we provide Managed Services (on premise support) for clients that do not have an IT department or need support with an existing IT staff. We become the department or a supplement to the existing IT Dept. This includes everything from break fix to project deployments.
Second, the other side of our business, Cloud Hosting, we host Citrix and Remote Desktop desktops for our clients who are choosing not to own equipment anymore. With this side of our business we have to support our clients in the field and with our datacenter operations. Our business is unique in that we can offer three types of solutions, on premise, hosted or a combination of the two.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

SENIOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER POSITION SUMMARY The Senior Systems Engineer will develop, implement, and support systems related services and solutions for consulting clients. This position will build a customer-focused relationship with client to identify business challenges and develop specifications and requirements to arrive at the best solution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
MITRE’s North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD)/United States Northern Command (USNORTHCOM), United States Space Command (USSPACECOM), United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM) Operations Department (N256) provides applied systems engineering/mission engineering for 3 Combatant Commands (CCMDs), to include HQ USSTRATCOM and the Nuclear Command, Control, and Communications (NC3) Enterprise Center (NEC). N256 provides technical expertise with NC3 systems, architectures, command and control structures, and systems engineering to bridge the command, and the rest of the DoD Enterprise, and in support of the Joint Force and Service Components.

This position will build a customer-focused relationship with client to identify business challenges and develop specifications and requirements to arrive at the best solution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Facebook Reality Labs is dedicated to the research and development required to bring virtual and augmented reality to billions of people around the world. We aspire to a vision of social VR and AR, where people are able to interact with each other across distances in a way that is indistinguishable from in-person interactions.We are looking for a talented Audio Systems Engineer to accelerate the progression to authentic social presence in virtual and augmented reality. In our current pipeline, a multitude of sensing components, including image sensors, microphones, speakers and inertial measurement units are installed on the prototype multi-sensor capture systems in order to collect a rich suite of information that reflects the user's physical state, with an emphasis on modality synchronicity and latency minimization; this information is then processed by our state-of-the-art algorithms to allow for a computational representation of the user.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Facebook Reality Labs is dedicated to the research and development required to bring virtual and augmented reality to billions of people around the world. We aspire to a vision of social VR and AR, where people are able to interact with each other across distances in a way that is indistinguishable from in-person interactions.We are looking for a talented Audio Systems Engineer to accelerate the progression to authentic social presence in virtual and augmented reality. In our current pipeline, a multitude of sensing components, including image sensors, microphones, speakers and inertial measurement units are installed on the prototype multi-sensor capture systems in order to collect a rich suite of information that reflects the user's physical state, with an emphasis on modality synchronicity and latency minimization; this information is then processed by our state-of-the-art algorithms to allow for a computational representation of the user.

As a Hardware Systems Engineer at Facebook Reality Labs, you will lead architecture on upcoming AR/VR/Wearables products, help drive the overall strategy & roadmap, and be a part of the teams designing, building, and testing prototypes for future consumer AR/VR/Wearables reality experiences. The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense. The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. With the ever-accelerating technological advances and growing system complexity, NSA needs System Engineers to integrate systems and reduce the cost to operate and maintain systems. To meet these demands, the NSA hires and trains talented and highly motivated junior and senior systems engineers, electrical engineers, computer scientists, computer engineers, and other related professionals. We need our System Engineers to provide program oversight and implement Systems Engineering best practices across the organization in the NSA enterprise. The need to maintain our core System Engineers group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The ever increasing complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class System Engineers to solve challenging systems engineering problems to enable NSA to successfully execute its mission. Recent college graduates and junior System Engineers are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office or one of two Development Programs (The System Engineer Development Program (SEDP) or the Information Technology Development Program (ITDP)). The SEDP prepares recent college graduates and junior level technical staff for a career in Systems Engineering at NSA. During the three-year program, participants will rotate assignments, attend training that covers the full breadth of systems engineering disciplines, and earn DoD DAWIA and other important credentials. The ITDP is a three-year full-time development program designed to provide entry-level information technology specialists (that is, individuals with degrees in computer science, information systems, information technology, and related degrees and experience) the opportunity to learn the various facets of the NSA mission, including: - Systems Engineering/Security Engineering - Software Engineering - SW Project Management - System Architecture - Database Design As a System Engineer at the NSA responsibilities may include: - requirements definition, requirements analysis and requirements management - system architecture and design - integration and testing - configuration management - risk management - decision analysis - security engineering - provide system engineering expertise, guidance and support to the development and implementation of mission capabilities that align with mission driven priorities - lead and implement system engineering effort, mentor junior personnel - capture high-level concepts and translate into engineering documents and other artifacts - act as advocates for and implement Systems Engineering and Enterprise Architecture best practices and principles - craft high-level system design, specify system/component performance and interface requirements and develop installation, integration and acceptance test plans

Our software-as-a-service solution integrates patient scheduling, medical records, billing and electronic claims to streamline the way mental health professionals manage their practice.
TherapyNotes offers careers that provide you with the freedom to do amazing work, interact with great people, and offer fantastic learning and growth opportunities. Our team empowers and challenges each other to learn and solve complex problems. We build and manage web applications with a strong emphasis in healthcare. If you are looking to join a supportive team, use your leadership experience, and build great products, please submit your application.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The responsibilities of this position require the engineer to provide a variety of technology services to our clients. This position will require a high energy individual that is able to keep up in a very fast paced work environment. Providing exceptional customer service is the first priority. The qualified candidate will rely on excellent problem solving, communication, organization and business skills to provide technology solutions for our clients and fellow team members.
Responsibilities Include:
- Independently investigate and implement solutions to technical issues
- Identify recurring technical issues and propose solutions to address the root of issues
-Troubleshoot and resolve customer technical issues relating to WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

This position requires a strong analyst with independent, collaborative, and entrepreneurial skills. The successful candidate will focus on applying analytic capabilities and developing integrated analytic solutions to maximize MITRE’s support across its customers.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
Situated near the University of Michigan North Campus, MITRE’s Ann Arbor office is growing a team to perform advanced algorithm research and development supporting the U.S. Army’s next-generation autonomous combat vehicles. The capabilities we develop are helping to define the future of military autonomy and ensure U.S. technical preeminence into the 21st century. Take this opportunity to become part of a technically diverse, high-performance team defined by independence, a self-starting attitude, and a passion for applying advanced ideas to solve real-world problems in autonomy.

We are seeking a candidates with a demonstrated or growing ability to independently identify, research, and solve challenging problems across the domain of disciplines related to modern autonomy. We are especially interested in expertise related to robotics, computer vision, machine learning, control theory, optimization, sensor fusion, and navigation. Qualified candidates should be comfortable shepherding novel algorithms from inception through implementation and deployment, and be able to communicate their contributions effectively to a technically diverse array of managers and stakeholders within MITRE and the sponsor community. In addition, we are seeking candidates eager to learn how to propose, lead, and contribute to competitive internal R&D efforts at MITRE directed toward advancing the state-of-the-art in fundamental technologies related to autonomy and robotics.

Facebook Reality Labs is dedicated to the research and development required to bring virtual and augmented reality to billions of people around the world. We aspire to a vision of social VR and AR, where people are able to interact with each other across distances in a way that is indistinguishable from in-person interactions.We are looking for a talented Audio Systems Engineer to accelerate the progression to authentic social presence in virtual and augmented reality. In our current pipeline, a multitude of sensing components, including image sensors, microphones, speakers and inertial measurement units are installed on the prototype multi-sensor capture systems in order to collect a rich suite of information that reflects the user's physical state, with an emphasis on modality synchronicity and latency minimization; this information is then processed by our state-of-the-art algorithms to allow for a computational representation of the user.

The Senior RF Systems Engineer will participate in and demonstrate excellent capabilities in electrical engineering subjects such as RF, digital, and analog design. This is an individual contributor role in which the engineer is part of a cohesive team of engineers responsible for communications products for global customers.
PRIMARY FUNCTION
To provide technical initiative in all phases of product development for high power RF systems by performing the following functions:
Devise the initial concept of the assigned device, component or system, and participate in the overall detailed product design
Assume minor project responsibility and carry it through various stages of development per established schedule as required

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

As a Hardware Systems Engineer at Facebook Reality Labs, you will lead architecture on upcoming AR/VR/Wearables products, help drive the overall strategy & roadmap, and be a part of the teams designing, building, and testing prototypes for future consumer AR/VR/Wearables reality experiences. We want people who: work well in teams, can brainstorm big ideas, work in new technology areas, thrive in ambiguity, able to map tradespaces, able to drive a concept into a prototype, and can envision how a prototype could transition into a high-volume consumer product.The Reality Labs Hardware Systems Engineer will lead the definition and convergence of complex and novel sub-system and product architectures aimed at pushing beyond the state-of-the-art consumer AR/VR/Wearable systems. These can span new sensing systems, display/optics systems, input devices, and full VR headsets. The role requires expert technical communication with cross-functional teams across ID, hardware engineering, partnerships, supply chain and core technology groups to drive incubation of new technologies from proof of concept through integration into products for mass production. This role requires excellent technical understanding of consumer electronics and AR/VR/Wearable reality systems across the stack.Starting with a broad engineering background in electrical, mechanical, optics, silicon, or related fields, we’re looking for a unique system designer or architect. The ideal candidate would have strong systems skills, previous roles driving architecture convergence on complex consumer electronics products, and experience with SoC evaluation, optical systems, sensors, CV algorithms, software, and be able to work collaboratively with experts in different fields to make architectural tradeoffs.

Facebook Reality Labs is dedicated to the research and development required to bring virtual and augmented reality to billions of people around the world. We aspire to a vision of social VR and AR, where people are able to interact with each other across distances in a way that is indistinguishable from in-person interactions.We are looking for a talented Audio Systems Engineer to accelerate the progression to authentic social presence in virtual and augmented reality. In our current pipeline, a multitude of sensing components, including image sensors, microphones, speakers and inertial measurement units are installed on the prototype multi-sensor capture systems in order to collect a rich suite of information that reflects the user's physical state, with an emphasis on modality synchronicity and latency minimization; this information is then processed by our state-of-the-art algorithms to allow for a computational representation of the user.
