SENIOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER POSITION SUMMARY The Senior Systems Engineer will develop, implement, and support systems related services and solutions for consulting clients. This position will build a customer-focused relationship with client to identify business challenges and develop specifications and requirements to arrive at the best solution. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  Work as a member of the HBS Systems team as a leader and contributor that provides consultative and proactive project support to HBS’s account base.  Collaborate and be a leader across multiple internal teams to ensure successful delivery and timely execution of the scope of work.

 Research new products for selection, enhance configuration standards and best practices and educate team members on these products and services to enhance the sales process.  Provide senior level support, maintenance, and administration for customer networks and review for other potential concerns or enhancement opportunities.  Work in and always model a positive team atmosphere between regional and virtual practices while maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.  Create and maintain detailed documentation of past projects to potentially provide time estimates and project scopes for new related projects.

 Obtain and maintain current vendor/industry specific certifications and stay current on new products and solutions by utilizing networks of resources.  Minimum of 1,450 hours billed per fiscal year prorated based on start date. These charge hour requirements will be balanced against professional development and on the job training. COMPETENCIES  Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his\her actions.

 Adaptability - Ability to fit into a changing environment.  Ambition - Extent that an individual demonstrates drive and initiative in seeking personal advancement or recognition.  Applied Learning- Applied learning looks at whether an individual takes part in needed learning activities in a way that makes the most of the learning experience.  Decision Making - Selecting an effective course of action while controlling resources and expenditures.

 Detail Orientated - Ability of an individual to pay meticulous attention to all aspects of a situation or task, no matter how small or seemingly unimportant.  Ethical - Ability to be guided by the company’s accepted principles of moral conduct.  Interpersonal- Interpersonal skills look at the ability of the individual to develop and maintain relationships with others.  Organized - Ability of an individual to be structured and methodical in working skills.

 Persistence - Ability to continue in a course of action in the face of adversity.  Technical Aptitude - Ability to relate to topics which require and understanding or specialized knowledge. SKILLS & ABILITIES Required Experience  3+ years in a technical related field. Preferred Experience  3 – 5 years in a technical related field.

 3+ years’ experience working as a consultant. Required Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience designing and architecting Microsoft Azure solutions: Including, but not limited to, Azure AD, Intune, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (or relevant) certifications: At least one or more CCNP, MCA, CCA-V, VCP  Experience designing and architecting systems-based solutions.  Installing and supporting Microsoft enterprise products. Preferred Skills, Education and/or Certifications:  Experience with SAML/ADFS.

 Including, but not limited to, Intune, Airwatch, Mobile Iron  At least two or more Professional level certifications.  CCNP, CCP-V, VCAP-DCV, MCE  Installing and supporting Cisco, HPE, or Dell servers and storage.  VMware vSphere best practices.  Data Center / Core design, configuration, and implementation utilizing Cisco Nexus Architecture (9K, 7K, 6K, 5K, 3K, 2K, 1000V).

 Familiarity or experience with solutions or platforms relevant to the business, such as:  Simplivity  Nutanix  Citrix  VMware Horizon  Nimble Storage Equal Opportunity Employer - Disabled/Vets

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense. The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. With the ever-accelerating technological advances and growing system complexity, NSA needs System Engineers to integrate systems and reduce the cost to operate and maintain systems. To meet these demands, the NSA hires and trains talented and highly motivated junior and senior systems engineers, electrical engineers, computer scientists, computer engineers, and other related professionals. We need our System Engineers to provide program oversight and implement Systems Engineering best practices across the organization in the NSA enterprise. The need to maintain our core System Engineers group is vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The ever increasing complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class System Engineers to solve challenging systems engineering problems to enable NSA to successfully execute its mission. Recent college graduates and junior System Engineers are hired into positions directly supporting a technical mission office or one of two Development Programs (The System Engineer Development Program (SEDP) or the Information Technology Development Program (ITDP)). The SEDP prepares recent college graduates and junior level technical staff for a career in Systems Engineering at NSA. During the three-year program, participants will rotate assignments, attend training that covers the full breadth of systems engineering disciplines, and earn DoD DAWIA and other important credentials. The ITDP is a three-year full-time development program designed to provide entry-level information technology specialists (that is, individuals with degrees in computer science, information systems, information technology, and related degrees and experience) the opportunity to learn the various facets of the NSA mission, including: - Systems Engineering/Security Engineering - Software Engineering - SW Project Management - System Architecture - Database Design As a System Engineer at the NSA responsibilities may include: - requirements definition, requirements analysis and requirements management - system architecture and design - integration and testing - configuration management - risk management - decision analysis - security engineering - provide system engineering expertise, guidance and support to the development and implementation of mission capabilities that align with mission driven priorities - lead and implement system engineering effort, mentor junior personnel - capture high-level concepts and translate into engineering documents and other artifacts - act as advocates for and implement Systems Engineering and Enterprise Architecture best practices and principles - craft high-level system design, specify system/component performance and interface requirements and develop installation, integration and acceptance test plans

Position Summary
This position will report to the Systems Team Supervisor. This position requires adaptability and comfort to work on different initiatives, and with many different teams (i.e. applications team, network team, etc.) providing leadership and creativity to tackle all obstacles. The Systems Engineer should be comfortable performing as an SME in any Microsoft-related enterprise services, Cloud strategy, PowerShell/automation techniques, experience with virtualization/VDI, monitoring/operational health management, and have best in class troubleshooting abilities. This position will work closely with vendors and consultants as well as other IS&T and MFA business units to develop and implement technology solutions where appropriate. This position will need to be a self-starter, able to drive process improvement, and have experience with ITSM best practices as well as project management abilities. There may be occasional travel for the position.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other duties may be assigned.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. A Wiring Systems Engineer opportunity is available on Bell’s AH-1Z and UH-1Y Upgrades Program. These positions are located at Bell Helicopter’s headquarters facility in Ft. Worth, TX or the Bell Flight Research Center in Arlington, TX.

The Wiring Systems Engineer is responsible for:
Developing system requirements, architecture, and interfaces for the aircraft wiring systems to integrate aircraft systems and manage databus and power requirements

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Facebook Reality Labs is dedicated to the research and development required to bring virtual and augmented reality to billions of people around the world. We aspire to a vision of social VR and AR, where people are able to interact with each other across distances in a way that is indistinguishable from in-person interactions.We are looking for a talented Audio Systems Engineer to accelerate the progression to authentic social presence in virtual and augmented reality. In our current pipeline, a multitude of sensing components, including image sensors, microphones, speakers and inertial measurement units are installed on the prototype multi-sensor capture systems in order to collect a rich suite of information that reflects the user's physical state, with an emphasis on modality synchronicity and latency minimization; this information is then processed by our state-of-the-art algorithms to allow for a computational representation of the user.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The Systems Engineer works in close collaboration with a cross-functional team made up of engineers, scientists, product management, clinical applications, researchers, customers, marketing and other field teams to define and develop new product technologies to meet customer needs. The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Manage and provide technical leadership for the applications programming and software support staff. Maintain quality assurance and currency for application systems development. Perform analysis oversight during initial design and problem solving-of programming assignments.

Aerospace System Engineer
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, systems engineering or a related specialized area or field is required plus a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience.

Job Title: Junior Systems Engineer

TDI Technologies, Inc. is seeking candidates for a machinery controls Junior Systems Engineer position. The main function of the candidate will be to provide lifecycle support of fielded Machinery Control Systems (MCS) on the USS ARLEIGH BURKE class of destroyer. This includes shipboard support as well as Land Based Engineering Site (LBES) support. The USS ARLEIGH BURKE MCS is comprised of four (4) different variants spanning various technologies.
As a valued member of TDI, you will join a team of diverse professionals noted for their achievements, innovation and excellence that will support the development of your career as you grow your technical skills. TDI employees have a positive attitude, strong work ethic and commitment to teamwork that is rewarded with a generous benefit package, fun employee activities and volunteer opportunities, and flexible work schedules. We strive to maintain a solid work/life balance - family is important.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

The Battery System Safety engineer leads the product design and development activities related to system safety for various hybrid/electric vehicle battery systems. This position entails working closely with HV battery release engineers, HV battery suppliers, HV battery & vehicle packaging engineers to lead battery design sufficiency analysis and release activities related to system safety for mechanical, electrical, thermal and system. The engineer will be responsible to ensure that the HV battery pack designs meets all safety related best practices and regulatory requirements.
The engineer will develop battery system safety work plans for thermal propagation and abuse venting design concepts, and will define design guidelines, simulation cases, define/collect the input data and will work with simulation teams to perform the necessary simulations to develop robust battery design for thermal propagation. The engineer will also develop test cases to validate the design concepts and simulation models, and finally, the verification of the pack design at pack level test.

Flight Research Associates, Inc.
Flight Research Associates, Inc. (FRA) is seeking an individual to join our team. FRA is a veteran-owned small business, specializing in advanced aviation research, development, engineering, test, evaluation, and simulation, and we are looking for a Visual Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer) to support FRA work to NASA Ames Research Center. This position requires an individual with system design of visual and voice communication experience and the ability to coordinate and execute multiple tasks, develop, optimize, and test the system design.
Job Description and Responsibilities:
The Visual Systems Engineer‘s responsibilities include support, integration, adaptation and system design of visual and voice communication system hardware and electronics at the NASA Ames Research Center, flight simulation and research laboratories (collectively known as “SimLab”). SimLab facilities include the Vertical Motion Simulator (VMS), the Crew Vehicle Simulation Research Facility (CVSRF) and Future Flight Central (FFC). Each facility employs a diverse suite of visual and voice communication technologies to affect real-time, human in the loop, aircraft, spacecraft, air traffic and management simulations.

Research emerging technologies and provide process improvement suggestions to benefit the government on such issues as help desk tickets, content management, document administration, etc.
Provide input on how to make the JTDI system easier to manage by suggesting new capabilities on the portal and in the software suite.

The Systems Engineer works in close collaboration with a cross-functional team made up of engineers, scientists, product management, clinical applications, researchers, customers, marketing and other field teams to define and develop new product technologies to meet customer needs. The Systems Engineer position distinguishes itself through a high emphasis on implementing and evaluating new product innovations and a strong focus on image/signal quality, system safety, and system calibration to drive significant design improvements in product architecture.
